# Billkerfy LLM Context

Billkerfy is a React + TypeScript + Vite web project.
For UI work, use Ant Design as the default component system.

## Project Snapshot

- Stack: React 19, TypeScript, Vite, React Router, Zustand, Appwrite.
- Package manager: Yarn.
- Icon preference: MingCute (`@mingcute/react` or `mingcute_icon`).
- UI direction: Ant Design first, avoid Tamagui for new work.

## Local Commands

- `yarn dev` start local dev server
- `yarn build` typecheck + production build
- `yarn lint` run lint checks
- `yarn preview` preview production build

## Repository Conventions

- Use Atomic Design structure for reusable UI: `atoms`, `molecules`, `organisms`, `templates`, `pages`.
- Use absolute imports with `@/`.
- Component folder shape:
  - `NameComponent/index.tsx`
  - `NameComponent/NameComponent.types.ts`
  - `NameComponent/NameComponent.styles.ts`
- State management: Zustand with focused stores by feature/domain.
- Use English for identifiers, file names, and code-level text.

## Ant Design Local Guidance

This repository does not rely on external URLs in `llms.txt`.
Use the local guidance below as the source of truth for Ant Design usage.

### Core Usage

- Prefer Ant Design components for all new UI.
- Wrap app root with `ConfigProvider` when theme customization is needed.
- Keep forms based on `Form`, `Input`, `Select`, and validation patterns from Ant Design.
- Use feedback primitives (`message`, `notification`, `Modal`) for global user feedback.

### Theming and Styling

- Use token-based styling through Ant Design theme configuration.
- Keep spacing and radius scales consistent across pages and features.
- Avoid ad-hoc color overrides unless required by UX.
- Reuse shared layout wrappers instead of duplicating page scaffolding.

### Recommended Component Set

- Foundation: `Button`, `Typography`, `Space`, `Grid`, `Layout`.
- Data entry: `Form`, `Input`, `InputNumber`, `Select`, `DatePicker`, `Upload`.
- Data display: `Table`, `Card`, `Tag`, `Tooltip`, `Badge`, `Avatar`.
- Navigation: `Menu`, `Tabs`, `Breadcrumb`, `Pagination`, `Dropdown`.
- Feedback: `Alert`, `Modal`, `Drawer`, `message`, `notification`, `Spin`, `Skeleton`.

### UX Defaults

- Default to accessible labels and clear validation states in forms.
- Keep primary actions explicit and secondary actions visually quieter.
- Use loading states for async operations and empty states for missing data.
- Prefer responsive layouts with mobile-safe spacing and controls.

## Implementation Defaults for Agents

- Prefer Ant Design components before creating custom primitives.
- Keep UI decisions aligned with Ant Design tokens and spacing.
- Use Zustand for shared UI states (modals, drawers, global filters).
- Use Appwrite adapters/services for backend integration logic.
- Do not introduce Tamagui in new changes.
